message.body: How did demo go so far?
The entire wall was all wacky shack though. The bricks were swaying back and forth the whole time.

Brian wrangled his cousin to keep it cheap. We could use another hand but it's just grunt work so it's only budgeted for $15/hr. We'll be framing next week though. So if you can do 2 or 3 days in a row you can make $25/hr for those days.

Ok. I'd try to get someone else for next week because I really need to work in getting my show together. Next week is my last week of classes to. So I could only do Wednesday and Friday. After that I only work Monday and Tuesday, but I also need time to get my art ready for oct9 install date

Yeah, it's no problem. I'll run the framing crew if you can't. I'd like some time off but I don't really need it and figured that's a role where you can get paid for your experience. There's also a bunch of trim and finish carpentry so maybe when that gets closer we can schedule you for that stuff.
